description: 2025 is already shaping up to be an extraordinary year for weather records in parts of the UK.

description: Marc Lamah, dropped by a private provider, continues to operate on NHS patients in Brighton.

description: Tottenham complete the signing of Mohammed Kudus from West Ham for £55m, subject to work permit.

description: A year ago, Amanda Anisimova was doing her best to avoid thinking about Wimbledon after failing to qualify for the main draw. Now she has a final to prepare for.

description: Ollie Pope says England will keep their “fingers crossed” Ben Stokes has not suffered a serious injury after the captain struggled on the first day of the third Test against India at Lord’s.

description: Rescue efforts included over 2,100 responders on the ground, private helicopters, drones, boats and cadaver-detecting dogs.

description: Package holidays from the UK to popular destinations are more expensive but there are ways to cut costs.

description: Starmer announces “one in, one out” migrant deal with France.

description: Details aside, the agreement is likely to encounter legal, political and practical obstacles.
title: 'One in, one out' sounds simple - but the deal could be complicated

description: The PM says the "one in, one out" deal with France would prove trying to get to the UK via the Channel would be "in vain".

description: Joe Root's superb unbeaten 99 leads England to 251-4 after day one of the third Test against India at Lord's.

description: Ireland's Ben Healy produces a stunning solo break to win stage six of the Tour de France while Mathieu van der Poel regains the race leader's yellow jersey.

description: The prototype of the most famous bag in fashion, made for Jane Birkin in 1985, smashes auction records.

description: Forssell says he will not resign over the issue and that his son has severed all ties with the groups.

description: Ukraine is in danger of being overwhelmed by deadly strikes as Russia sends in swarms of drones.

description: Amanda Anisimova deals out more Grand Slam heartbreak to Aryna Sabalenka as she books her place in the Wimbledon final.

description: Harry Brook is bowled for 11 by Jasprit Bumrah as India make a strong start after tea, reducing England to 172-4 on the opening day of the third Test against England at Lord's.

description: Tottenham open talks with Nottingham Forest over a possible £60m move for Morgan Gibbs-White.

description: Suspensions and exclusions rose in the last school year - with a significant increase among primary-age pupils.

description: After Christian Horner's departure, we analyse whether four-time world champion Max Verstappen is now more likely to remain at Red Bull.

description: Coney Beach Amusement Park in Porthcawl is to close in October, the owners announce.
title: Seafront funfair to shut after more than 100 years

description: The TV presenter was criticised after he appeared to link claims of misconduct to his autism diagnosis.

description: BBC Sport looks at how goalkeeper Hannah Hampton helped England get their title defence back on track at Euro 2025.
title: How striker-turned-keeper Hampton's 'unreal' passes boost England

description: Chancellor Rachel Reeves is expected to make changes to Isa rules, but what are they and how do they work?

description: Nitish Kumar Reddy removes Ben Duckett and Zak Crawley in his opening over, as well as seeing Ollie Pope dropped by India captain Shubman Gill as the tourists make their breakthrough on day one of the third Test against England at Lord's.

description: Luxury cars and wads of cash were seized as part of an investigation into a complex scam targeting HMRC.

description: Three men and one woman - aged between 17 and 20 - have been arrested in London and the Midlands.

description: There had been concerns that the power supply has been put at risk at two major hospitals because it lies near a major electricity substation.

description: The new deputy director says his organisation was "totally accountable" for the violence at Trump's rally in 2024.

description: According to reports a $3bn deal could be finalised this week, combining the two major food firms.

description: Leader Kemi Badenoch will set out her plans to restrict welfare payments in a speech on Thursday.

description: Thursday's front pages focus on Red Bull's removal of Christian Horner and fresh analysis of benefits payments
